complication.text: It keeps a quiet tally of favors taken. Sometimes it demands repayment at the worst possible moment.
It dislikes broken promises; when one is made nearby, it grows uncomfortably heavy.
A fey patron occasionally calls in ‘minor courtesies’ that never feel minor.
It attracts trouble the way metal attracts lightning—rarely, but never conveniently.
It works best after being ‘fed’ a secret. The more valuable the secret, the more satisfied it seems.
